title: 105_s1130
content: SECTION 1. ASSESSMENT OF FEES. Section 18(a) of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act is amended to include minimum regulatory fees for class II and class III gaming activities, requiring a quarterly payment of $250 per gaming operation. The Commission will establish a fee schedule for class II gaming activities regulated by the Act, with fees not exceeding 2.5% of gross revenues. The total fees imposed in a fiscal year shall not exceed $5,000,000. The Commission will establish a fee schedule for class III gaming activities, with fees set at $5,000,000 for 1998, $8,000,000 for 1999, and $10,000,000 for 2000 and beyond. Fees for each class III gaming activity will be determined by the Commission. The fee schedule for class III gaming activities sets fees at a maximum of 0.5% of gross revenues. The total fees imposed in a fiscal year cannot exceed $3,000,000 for 1998, $4,000,000 for 1999, and $5,000,000 for 2000 and beyond. The aggregate amount of fees collected under paragraph (2) shall not exceed $8,000,000 for fiscal year 1998, $12,000,000 for fiscal year 1999, and $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2000 and beyond. The Commission shall consider its duties and services when assessing and collecting fees. A special fund will be established by the Secretary of the Treasury to deposit fees paid. The Treasury will deposit fees paid into a special fund for the Commission's activities under the Act. Amendments are made to paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) regarding consequences of failure to pay fees, credit, and gross revenues. The Indian Gaming Regulatory Act is amended to specify the budget of the Commission, including requests for appropriations and the contents of the budget for each fiscal year. The Treasury will deposit fees into a special fund for the Commission's activities. Amendments are made regarding consequences of failure to pay fees, credit, and gross revenues. The Indian Gaming Regulatory Act is amended to specify the budget of the Commission, including requests for appropriations. Fees collected in the preceding fiscal year will be used for the Commission's activities, with a minimum of $1,000,000 allocated. The Indian Gaming Regulatory Act is amended to authorize appropriations to the Commission, with fees collected in the previous fiscal year used for activities, and a minimum allocation of $1,000,000.
